Conditional link_to - #rails
entry.summary: ActionView::Helper using #link_to_if <%= link_to_if(current_user.nil?, "Login", login_path) %> true it would output: Login false it just outputs the text: Login <%= link_to_if(current_user.nil?, "Login", login_path) do link_to("Logout", logout_path) end %> link_to_unless method available docs if you're interested.

entry.title: Unix Timestamps in Elixir - #elixir
entry.summary: DateTime struct, and want to keep things simple, you can convert a DateTime struct to an integer with to_unix/2. By default, it will use seconds as the unit.

entry.title: Skip auto updates for brew install/upgrade/tap - #workflow
entry.summary: Running `brew update --auto-update`... all of your formulae to update, just so you can use the one that you need. HOMEBREW_NO_AUTO_UPDATE to 1. HOMEBREW_NO_AUTO_UPDATE=1 brew install <formula> official docs: brew install, brew upgrade or brew tap.

entry.title: How programmers flex on each other
Command Line Wildcards - #command-line
entry.summary: * character can be used as a wildcard to match sequences of unknown characters in the command line. For example, lets say my elixir project has a few tests that I want to run in a directory: MyProject/tests. The folder is filled with a bunch of random files, but the ones that i want to run have a similar name, tests/user_views_home and tests/user_views_show. We could use a wild card to match on both of these file names and run the tests (assuming there are no other files that match) like this: mix test MyProject/tests/user_views*

entry.title: Place screenshot straight to clipboard on Mac - #workflow
entry.summary:
cmd+shift+4. This brings up a crosshair to select which part of the screen you want. cmd+ctrl+shift+4. Then you can just paste the image wherever as soon as you're done. This is awesome but is a hard keystroke for me. However I discovered that you can use the original cmd+shift+4 to activate the crosshair but it can be redirected to the pastebin if you hold ctrl before you click to finalize the screenshot'd section.
Hooray!

entry.title: How to get javascript params in LiveView? - #elixir
ActiveRecord Query with `and` - #rails
entry.summary:
and method for querying. Post.where(id: [1, 2]).and(Post.where(id: [2, 3])) # SELECT "posts".* FROM "posts" WHERE "posts"."id" IN (1, 2) AND "posts"."id" IN (2, 3) wheres: Post.where(id: [1, 2]).where(id: [2, 3]) and really shines if you have more complicated querying with nesting of ANDs and ORs: SELECT "posts".* FROM "posts" WHERE "posts"."id" IN (1, 2) AND ("posts"."title" = 'title' OR "posts"."body" IS NOT NULL) where and or doesn't get us what we want: Post.where(id: [1,2]) .where(title: 'title') .or(Post.where.not(body: nil))
# SELECT "posts".* # FROM "posts" # WHERE ("posts"."id" IN (1, 2) # AND "posts"."title" = 'title' # OR "posts"."body" IS NOT NULL) A AND (B OR C) we get A AND B OR C. We can use a well-placed and to get the right grouping of conditions: Post.where(id: [1,2]) .and(Post.where(title: 'title') .or(Post.where.not(body: nil)))
# SELECT "posts".* # FROM "posts" # WHERE "posts"."id" IN (1, 2) # AND ("posts"."title" = 'title' # OR "posts"."body" IS NOT NULL) Docs Craig Hafer
